div.l: Saue al þis compane grete and smale
Thus haue I quyt þe myllere his tale
Here endith þe Revis tale and
begynneth þe cokis ꝓprolog
THe cook of london while the Reve spak
For ioie he þouȝte he clawid him on the bak
Ahay quod he for cristis owen passioıı̄un
This myllere hath A sharp conclusioıı̄un
Vp on his Argument of herbegage
Wel saide salamon in his langage
Ne preesse not euery man in þi hous
For herborwynge be nyȝt is perlous
Wel ouȝt A man avisid forto be
Whom þat he brynge in to his pryuite
I prey to god so ȝeve me sorow ⁊and care
Syn evir þat I hiȝte hog off ware
Herd I myllere bet I set A werk
He hadde a Iape of malice in þe derk
But god forbede that we stynten here
And þerfore if ye vouche saaf to here
A tale of me þat am a poer man̄
I wol yow telle as wel as I can
A litil iape þat fil in our cite
Our ost answerd and saide I graunte it þe
Now tel on Roger loke þat it be good
For many a pasty hast thow lete blood
And many A iacke of douyr hast þou sold
That hath be twis hoot ⁊and twys cold
Of many A pilgrym hast thou cristis curs
For of thi perseli ȝit fare þey þe wers
Now tel on gentil Roger be þi name
But I pray þe be not wroth for game
A man may say ful soth in game ⁊and pley
Thow saist soth saide Roger be my fey
But soth pley quead pley as þᵉ flemyng saith
And þerfore harry bably be þi feith
Be thow not wroth ar we departen here
